description.narrative: The Programme aims to strengthen institutions, enterprises and communities to improve their productive and income generation capacities by supporting the development of inclusive green value chains in tourism, mining, and agriculture sectors.

participating-org.narrative: UGA Min of Water and Env

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
3.1.1.1: No. of target institutions that have implemented policies, strategies, and budgets that integrate sustainable energy, natural resource and land management, biodiversity, climate change mitigation and resilience initiatives.
3.1.1.2: Hectares of land (in target areas) that are managed under a conservation, sustainable use or access and benefits sharing regime, disaggregated by category (IRRF 1.5)
3.1.1.4: No. of new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions on natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or subnational levels, disaggregated by partnership type (MDAs, DLGs and CBO Agreements).
3.1.2.1: % of population in targeted districts with access to renewable energy sources.
3.1.2.2: No. of people benefiting from strengthened livelihoods through solutions for natural resources management, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste.
3.1.3.1: No. of functional platforms established to engage citizens at all levels for sustainable environment and natural resources, disaggregated by category.
3.1.3.2: No. of new partnership mechanisms with funding for: (a) Sustainable management solutions of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or sub-national level (b) Improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions targeting undeserved communities/groups and women.
3.2.1.1: No. of country diagnostics conducted by relevant MDAs that have informed policy options on national response to sustainable development options.
3.2.1.2: No. of targeted MDAs that have implemented inclusive, market-oriented and environmentally responsive policies, plans and strategies.
3.2.2.2: No. of pilot and demonstration projects/business models initiated or scaled up by national partners.
3.2.2.3: No. of new functional partnerships implementing innovative solutions for development.
3.2.3.2: Percentage of targeted MSMEs that comply with corporate governance standards.

comment.narrative:

3.1.1.4: 131 (2013) new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions on natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or subnational levels, disaggregated by partnership type (MDAs, DLGs and CBO Agreements).
3.1.2.1: 10 (M/F: 50/50) (2013) % of population in targeted districts with access to renewable energy sources
23,424,172 (M/F: 49/51) (2013);

3.1.1.1. 10 institutions have implemented policies, strategies, and budgets that integrate sustainable energy, natural resource and land management, biodiversity, climate change mitigation and resilience initiatives.
3.1.2.1: 15ha of trees and 2 nurseries of 30,000 seedlings established in target areas and managed under a conservation, sustainable use or access and benefits sharing regime, disaggregated by category .
3.1.2.2: No target
3.1.3.1: One functional platform established to engage citizens at all levels for sustainable environment and natural resources, disaggregated by category.
3.1.3.2: No target
3.2.1.1: Two country diagnostics conducted by relevant MDAs that have informed policy options on national response to sustainable development options.
3.2.1.2: 3 targeted MDAs that have implemented inclusive, market-oriented and environmentally responsive policies, plans and strategies.
3.2.2.3: 10 new functional partnerships implementing innovative solutions for development.
3.2.3.2: No target
Indicator 3.2.2.2 is indicated in output 00102857

3.1.1.1. Fourteen target institutions in both the public and private sectors that have implemented policies, strategies, and budgets that integrate sustainable energy, natural resource and land management, biodiversity, climate change mitigation and resilience initiatives.
3.1.2.1: 15ha of trees and 2 nurseries of 30,000 seedlings have been established in Ruhama, Ntungamo District to improve on tree cover and provide livelihood assets (mainly income) for the local community.
3.1.2.2: No intervention undertaken.
3.1.3.1: A virtual platform established as a mechanism for community empowerment and involvement in environmental monitoring and enforcement.
3.2.1.1: Country diagnostics conducted that have informed policy options on national response to sustainable development increased from 93 in 2019 to 97 in 2020.
3.2.1.2: 4 targeted MDAs have implemented inclusive, market-oriented and environmentally responsive policies, plans and strategies.
3.2.2.3: 21 new functional partnerships implementing innovative solutions for development.
3.2.3.2: No intervention undertaken

3.1.2.1: 25% of population in three targeted districts in Northern Uganda with access to renewable energy sources
